company_timeline.description: Dr. Kneeland Youngblood founded Pharos Capital Group as physician-founded private equity firm
Built portfolio of 58 total investments across healthcare sector with focus on underserved markets
company_timeline.significance: Established track record in healthcare private equity

company_timeline.description: Pharos Capital invested in Renal Care 360, capitalizing new chronic kidney care management platform
company_timeline.significance: Demonstrates focus on chronic care management and patient outcomes

company_timeline.description: Pharos Capital made majority investment in RhythMedix healthcare technology company
company_timeline.significance: Recent acquisition activity showing continued growth strategy

company_timeline.description: Kneeland Youngblood ranked #50 on inaugural Forbes BLK50 list of most powerful Black Americans
company_timeline.significance: National recognition for business leadership and social impact

company_timeline.description: Successfully completed SEC examination using Ontra compliance platform, saving 40 hours in response time
company_timeline.significance: Demonstrates regulatory compliance excellence and operational efficiency

company_timeline.description: Youngblood participated in invite-only panel 'Private Equity and Patient Care: A Delicate Balancing Act' at 28th Annual Global Conference
company_timeline.significance: Industry thought leadership recognition in healthcare PE ethics

regulatory_timeline.description: Initial SEC registration as investment advisor (CRD 316789)

regulatory_timeline.significance: Government relations activity and regulatory engagement

regulatory_timeline.description: No SEC regulatory issues, fraud allegations, or major legal controversies identified

leadership_timeline.description: Dr. Youngblood practiced emergency room medicine at Baylor University Medical Center and Medical Center of Plano
leadership_timeline.significance: Medical expertise foundation for healthcare investing approach

leadership_timeline.description: Youngblood transitioned from medical practice to founding private equity firm
leadership_timeline.significance: Career pivot from practitioner to investor

leadership_timeline.description: Youngblood sued ConocoPhillips for $900 million claiming family's claim to oil-rich land in Texas
leadership_timeline.significance: Personal legal activity related to family heritage and property rights

growth_milestones.significance: Substantial fund size demonstrating investor confidence
Multiple fund generations showing institutional development
Demonstrated ability to generate returns for investors
Active investment management and portfolio optimization
